analysis: The job responsibilities focus on developing and enhancing risk models, quantitative analytics, and predictive models for investment portfolios. The emphasis is on using advanced statistical, quantitative, econometric, and machine learning techniques. The responsibilities also include working closely with portfolio managers, conducting scenario analyses, and leading the development and governance of quantitative modeling tools. The skills required include strong programming skills, data engineering expertise, and knowledge of machine learning, but there is no specific mention of Generative AI or language models (LLMs). The focus is more on traditional quantitative and machine learning techniques rather than on generative or language model technologies.
